options.content:
# IBM Runbook Automation

Each minute the status of the runbook and automation service and connections RBA has configured are checked via the API (documented [here](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/runbook-automation?topic=api-runbook-automation-documentation)). Each important API endpoint ("status", "runbooks", statistics") status is checked for its availability. Current state (UP or DOWN) is detailed here. 

In addition, status metrics are captured at the action and runbook level. To view open the "Actions" or "Runbooks" drop-down below.

To review SLI performance over time you should review the visualisations in the corresponding drop-down below.

panels.description: This is a count of production runbook executions and alert action runs
panels.title: Executions

panels.description: This is a count of action executions by status
panels.title: Action executions by status

options.content:
# RBA Component Availability

The SLO target for availability for all components is 95%

The dashboard time-picker will control time-based charts but be aware that the "SLI Period" picker top-left will determine the SLI lookback period. Example - If you have set the SLI Period to 7 days, time-based charts will be calculating the SLI period on a rolling 7 day basis. The dashboard time-picker will dictate the time period you observe the SLI performance not the SLI lookback period.

panels.description: This is a count of production runbook executions and alert action runs

panels.title: Executions by status

options.content:
# IBM RBA - Burn Rate Consumption

Availability SLO Target - 95%

### Availability Burn Rate Windows

5% Error Budget over 7 days - 504 minutes

Fast Burn - 2% over Long Window - 1 hour, 2% over Short Window - 20 minutes

Burn Rate Calculation - 2% (10 minutes unavailability) over 1 hour:
.02 x (7*24*60) / Long Window (1 hour) = 3.36

Alerting Threshold - Burn Rate X SLO:
3.36 * 0.05 = 0.168
Fire Conditions - Burn Rate(1hr) and Burn Rate(20m) > 0.168
Clear Conditions - Burn Rate(1hr) and Burn Rate(20m) > 0.168
